docs.text: Assessments Static Code Analysis Soluble Fusion platform allows you to operationalize the data collected from the open source static code analysis tools like: Cfn Python Lint TfSec Checkov Terrascan We let you use your existing policies created for the above open source tools and take advantage of the community contributed policies along with the Soluble policies developed for you. We give you flexibility to run one or more of such tools, to provide maximum security coverage of your infrastructure and help you with vendor free lock-in. If you want us to integrate with any other tools, please let us know by emailing the support . You need Soluble CLI to start using the above tools. Please follow the Soluble CLI installation steps to install the CLI. Image Scanning Soluble provides a simple and comprehensive Vulnerability scanner for container and other artifacts. Easy to plugin in to CI. Posture Management Soluble posture management checks for misconfigurations that can lead to data breaches and leaks. This automated detection allows organizations to make necessary changes on a continuous, ongoing basis. Secrets Scanning Soluble secrets scanner searches through git repositories for secrets. Plugging this CLI service into the CI provides an easy to way to prevent accidental check-in of secrets.

docs.text: Soluble Basics User Management Every user signed up for Soluble will be provided with a default organization. And the user has the ability to invite other people to his organization and can be assigned a role ( Owner , Write and Read ). Each invited user will be part of the organization he is invited for and a default organization of his own, so he can explore Soluble on his own. Invite user Under settings , press Users . Under the Users, press Invite . Provide the email address of the person whom you would like to invite to your organization and select a role from the dropdown. User roles explained below. Press Invite Roles Each user role is specific to that particular organization where it was applied. * Owner - The user who created the initial account for the organization is the Owner. The Owner will have access to all the functionalities in that particular organization. He has the permission to grant / revoke permissions to the other users in the organization. Write - The user has the permissions for reading and writing any entities in the organization except for Users and Billing . Read - The user has permissions to read anything in the organization. Tokens Soluble Tokens are of two types: Access tokens - These are used for integrating Soluble with other party tools such as Soluble CLI etc. Agent tokens - These are used by Soluble agents deployed in Kubernetes clusters. Generate Access token To generate an access token Under Settings , press Tokens . Under the access tokens, click on Generate Access Token . Agent Tokens All the agent tokens used by Soluble agents for kubernetes should be visible under the Agent tokens. Token Management Any user with the right permissions will be able to Disable or Revoke tokens. Organization Setup The owner of the organization can configure the Organization settings like the display name of the organization, Login provider for organization. Organization ID is provided by the Soluble itself and users don’t have access to edit them. Alerts Alerts provide an easy way to handle any issues identified by the Soluble Fusion platform. Alerts are automatically created by Soluble as well as they can be created for any particular issue in findings from the assessments. Soluble when integrated with other third party platforms like Slack, Jira., it provides an easy way to manage the security / configuration issues identified by Soluble. Dashboard Soluble dashboard provides an easy way for tracking, analyzing and displaying the key information, which helps you to monitor the security / configuration issues in your infrastructure. Integrations Soluble provides an easy way to integrate with third party tools like Slack Jira AWS kubernetes To integrate with the above tools, click on the Integrations sidebar navigation. Slack Soluble can be integrated with just a click of a button. Configuring Slack with Soluble: Navigate to Integrations page and click on Slack Tile Configure button. Jira You need Jira API token for this. Enter the following Jira details to finish the integration. URL - Domain of the Jira URL of your organization. Username - Jira username of the provided api token. Key - API token created above. Default Project - Provides the default project that can be used by Soluble to create Jira tickets for Soluble alerts. AWS Soluble can be integrated with AWS by running a simple script. Adding an AWS Account: Under the Integrations side menu, click on the AWS tile. Click on the Add Account button and follow the instructions provided there. kubernetes To add kubernetes clusters to Soluble: Under the Kubernetes side navigation, select Clusters . Click on Add Cluster and follow the three simple steps provided there.
docs.title: Soluble Basics

docs.text: Cinderella clusters Soluble Cinderella clusters provide a quick, easy way to explore the kubernetes ecosystem. Create a cluster, deploy containers, test different configurations. Cinderella clusters are automatically deleted when their times run out. Try Cinderella You won’t have to do this every time you start a Cinderella cluster. Click on the link Click on "Let's go!" to get started. Next we need to import one (or more) SSH public keys so we can log in to the node running the cluster. If you have a GitHub account with SSH public keys, Soluble can just import those; that’s what we’ll do here: After clicking on Add, the keys are imported and we’re taken to the loading page. It takes about a minute for the cluster to spin up. When the cluster is ready, you’ll receive a notification in the upper right corner. When you click Continue , you’ll be taken to the Cinderella Clusters page: Next we’ll log in to the node running the cluster via SSH. To make this easy, we can copy the SSH command to log in to the node by clicking on the three vertical dots in the Actions column of the row with our Cinderella cluster: Next, open a terminal window, paste the command you copied at the prompt, and hit return. We’ll be asked to confirm the SSH key of the remote host and will get a prompt that looks something like: Run the kubectl command and explore the cluster.
docs.title: Cinderella clusters

docs.text: CLI This is the optional command line interface for interacting with Soluble APIs: Installation Mac OS The easiest way to install the CLI for MacOS is to use homebrew : brew install soluble-ai/soluble/soluble-cli To upgrade to the latest version: brew upgrade soluble-ai/soluble/soluble-cli On Linux, run: curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/soluble-ai/soluble-cli/master/linux-install.sh | sh Download from Soluble UI Soluble CLI can be installed by running the command provided in the Soluble UI. Click on the CLI in the sidebar. Run the command provided there. The install will drop the executable in the current directory. Move it to wherever is convenient. Windows executables can be found on the releases page . Build from source It's possible to build from source. Assuming you have go installed: git checkout https://github.com/soluble-ai/soluble-cli.git ./hack/build.sh ./soluble version Usage You'll need to generate an access token from the UI . Copy the access token and run: $ soluble auth set-access-token --access-token <your-access-token> OR $ soluble login If successful the CLI will show your user profile. Some useful commands: Get help: $ soluble help List clusters: $ soluble cluster list List available queries: $ soluble query list Run a query named deployments $ soluble query run --query-name deployments
docs.title: CLI

docs.text: Quick Start Overview Soluble Fusion is a SaaS platfom for managing Security-related services for Kubernetes. It consists of two primary components: Soluble Fusion API Services and Web Application - This is hosted by Soluble. The endpoint is https://app.soluble.cloud Soluble Agent - This is a kubernetes operator that runs in your kubernetes clusters. Getting Started Step 1: Enroll in 30 seconds Open a browser to https://app.soluble.cloud Click Create Account Select Google or GitHub (let us know if you'd like to see other identity providers) Select your account Agree to Terms of Service Done! Step 2: Follow Guided Setup The rest of the setup instructions are provided in the app itself:

docs.text: Repositories Soluble Repositories view provides an easy view that contains all you need to know to get you quickly up-to-date about a repository. It's a single plane of view for all the Static code analysis report, Image scanning results and Secrets scanner. Using the Soluble CLI inventory scanner, you get a list of what kind of files the repository contains and their corresponding assessment results. Repository view also provide an easy way to view assessment report for all the recent git branches and also allows to view a diff between two commits of a repo. This allows the user to make decisions on the security posture of a repository.
docs.title: Repositories
